    Research Interests

    Digital Humanities, Research Support, Teaching and Learning, GLAM community, Community Engagement

    Work Experience

    • Project Manager, Archives Unleashed, University of Waterloo, 2017 - Present
    • Research Manager, Private Startup, 2015 - 2017
    • Community Engagement Manager, Social Media Lab, Ryerson University, 2013-2016
    • Interim Project and Community Manager, Islandora Foundation, 2014
    • Reference and Research Intern, Killiam Memorial Library, Dalhousie University, 2013-2014
    • Research Assistance, Dalhousie University, Social Media Lab, 2013-2014
    • Teaching Assistant, Dahousie University, School of Information Management (2013)

    Scope of work for each professional experience can be found through my LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/samvfritz/

    Journal Articles

    2. Fritz, S., Milligan, I., Ruest, N., and Lin, J. (2020). Fostering Community Engagement through Datathon Events: The Archives Unleashed Experience. Digital Humanities Quarterly, Vol. 15, No. 1

    3. Ruest, N., Fritz, S., Deschamps, R., Lin, J., and Milligan, I. (2021). From archive to analysis: accessing web archives at scale through a cloud-based interface. International Journal of Digital Humanities.

    Peer-Reviewed Conference Publications + Posters

    1. Helge Holzmann, Nick Ruest, Jefferson Bailey, Alex Dempsey, Samantha Fritz, Peggy Lee, and Ian Milligan. ABCDEF: the 6 key features behind scalable, multi-tenant web archive processing with ARCH: archive, big data, concurrent, distributed, efficient, flexible. In Proceedings of the 22nd ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries (JCDL ‘22). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 1–11 (2022). https://doi.org/10.1145/3529372.3530916 [preprint]

    2. Ruest, N., Lin, J., Milligan, I., and Fritz, S. (2020). The Archives Unleashed Project: Technology, Process, and Community to Improve Scholarly Access to Web Archives. In Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries (JCDL ’20). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 157–166 (2020) https://doi.org/10.1145/3383583.3398513 [preprint] [presentation]

    3. Deschamps, R., Fritz, S., Lin, J., Milligan, I and Ruest, N. (2019). The Cost of a WARC: Analyzing Web Archives in the Cloud. Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries, Vol. 19. doi: 10.1109/JCDL.2019.00043. [preprint]

    4. Ian Milligan, Nathalie Casemajor, Samantha Fritz, Jimmy Lin, Nick Ruest, Matthew S. Weber, and Nicholas Worby. Building Community and Tools for Analyzing Web Archives through Datathons. Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries, Vol. 19 (2019). preprint

    5. Adewoye, T., Han, X., Ruest, N., Milligan, I., Fritz, S., and Lin, J. Content-Based Exploration of Archival Images Using Neural Networks. In Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries in 2020 (JCDL ’20). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 489–490 (2020). [preprint] [poster demo] [video summary]

    6. Deschamps, R., Ruest,N., Lin, J., Fritz, S., and Milligan, I. (2019). The Archives Unleashed Notebook: Madlibs for Jumpstarting Scholarly Exploration of Web Archives. Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries, Vol. 19. doi: 10.1109/JCDL.2019.00059. [preprint]

    7. Milligan, I., Casemajor, N., Fritz, S., Lin, J., Ruest, N., Weber, M.S., and Worby, N. (2019). Building Community and Tools for Analyzing Web Archives through Datathons. Proceedings of the ACM/IEEE Joint Conference on Digital Libraries, Vol. 19. doi: 10.1109/JCDL.2019.00044. preprint
